intro: Seruneum natalense, commonly known as Natal seroot, is a rare and endangered plant species native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy fruits. It thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is typically found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to habitat loss, Seruneum natalense is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
